committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Economic Policy and Trade

official_title: To establish a National Trade Council, and for other purposes.

summary.text: National Trade Council Act - Establishes the National Trade Council in the Executive Office of the President to provide advice on integration of national and international policies relating to international trade, business policy, and other issues affecting U.S. industry competitiveness. Requires the Council to have a staff to be headed by the National Trade Adviser who shall be appointed by the President. Requires the Council to report annually to the Congress on the international trade and economic position of the United States. Requires the submission of a trade impact statement in cases where the provisions of a regulation, Executive order, or executive agreement, or bill or resolution reported by a congressional committee, would have a significant impact on the ability of significant domestic product and service industries to compete in domestic and international markets against foreign products. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To establish a National Trade Council, and for other purposes.
